title: Attitude-Behavior Change Strategy Development through Educational Persuasive Game Design

context.prior_knowledge: Fundamental understanding of social studies teaching/learning methodologies and game-based learning
context.additional_context: Strengthening competencies in developing educational games for pre-service and in-service teachers, applying persuasive message design and attitude-behavior change theories

learning_goals: Analysis of persuasive game core elements (message design, motivation, behavior change conditions) to construct an applicable design framework for educational contexts
Application of at least three persuasive techniques that induce attitude changes in VR/simulation environments to actual game scenarios
Design of a summative assessment system linking attitudes acquired in-game to real-world behaviors
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
